intro: Mollugo decandra, commonly known as the common bladderwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Molluginaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, southern Europe, and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It is a herbaceous annual, meaning it completes its life cycle within a single growing season. Mollugo decandra is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
